title: Export, import to a saved bookmarks file in Firefox, is it possible?
content:
Hello. Is it possible to Export, import to a file of saved bookmarks in Firefox?

I know that it is possible to remember them on the user's account. But in large companies / government institutions where computers are in the server's domain, such functions are often blocked. When an employee has a changed computer, this data cannot be saved in order to be transferred to the new computer. Or is there a hidden feature?
creator: gilban

title: Chronik wird nach beenden von Firefox immer gelöscht

Ich habe schon Firefox neu installiert, ein ganz neues Profil gemacht und Firefox bereinigt. immer das gleiche Problem, keine Chronik vorhanden?! title: Previous Session not restored and then all bookmarks/history erased
content:
I closed a session with about 70 tabs, and upon reopening, firefox opened two windows, and the "restore previous session" was grayed out. I looked at "recently closed tabs" and there was only about 5 recent google searches in there, and none of my older tabs.

I closed the windows and tried again, this time "restore" was available but it opened only one tab to a website I hadn't had open in a session for weeks.

So I tried the fix listed here: https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1245632

Renamed the folder. And now on opening, all of my history, my bookmarks, my bookmark toolbar, is completely gone, and the only toolbar bookmark I have is "Getting Started" like a brand new version of firefox.

Please help, I have so many important websites in my bookmarks and I'm ruined if I can't restore them.
creator: rschwalm

title: Unable to browse special URLs

creator: lavanyadeepak

title: How to COMPLETELY disable screen sharing and microphone access?
content:
As a privacy-conscious person, I find some of Firefox's new features disturbing.

Bad enough that Firefox can share my clipboard with sites (hopefully disabled by setting dom.event.clipboardevents.enabled to FALSE).

But I've learned that Firefox can now capture my screen and share that with sites! What a privacy nightmare - one bug and the entire world sees my most personal documents! And if I had a microphone or camera plugged in, Firefox could share that too!

Please could someone tell me what is the most absolute, thorough way to disable these horrible features at the top level, so that they could NEVER be allowed to operate, not even by a bug?
creator: MartyJames

title: Certificate problems prevent entering many websites
content:
This started happening on many websites this week. Sometimes refreshing the page helps, sometimes it doesn't.

I'm only using Windows Defender and Tinywall (blocks everything through windows firewall) as security.

The websites I'm entering are definitely safe and don't have expired certificates (like Reddit).
creator: civanT

title: Ports don't work after updating Firefox to 85.0
content:
After updating to version 85.0 Firefox refuses to connect to some ports that are used in my private network. It shows this message:

"This address uses a network port which is normally used for purposes other than Web browsing. Firefox has cancelled the request for your protection."

These ports have been working successfully for five years. They still work in other browsers.

I found old resolutions for similar issues, using "about:config" but it seems they do not apply to this version.

Neither can I find anything in the Options UI to turn off such feature.

Is this done deliberately or an unfortunate mistake?

Caius
creator: sanajakuva

So the import bookmarks from another browser is now totally useless.

title: "Don’t enable HTTPS-Only Mode" not working
content:
My solar inverter, on my local wi-fi network, has an http:// web page for accessing graphs, stats and settings.

Firefox 85.0 (64-bit) will not allow me to access this device, always changing http: to https:, without giving me the option to 'accept the risk and continue', only 'Try again'. I cannot find any way to get around this and access the device.

In the FF options, I have "Don’t enable HTTPS-Only Mode" selected, but it is obviously not working.

How can I access my inverter's web pages?

Thanks, Daniel
creator: dfnojunk
